title: 2 Simple Ways to Send a Friend Invite on Discord

steps.title: Click the Discord logo in the top-right corner.
steps.content: Click the Discord logo in the top-right corner. You can use the desktop app on Windows or Mac, or the web client at https://discord.com . This will take you to your homepage. [2] X Research source If you aren't already logged in, enter your details to do so now or create an account .

steps.title: Click the Friends tab.
steps.content: Click the Friends tab. You'll see it in the left panel.

steps.title: Click Add Friend.
steps.content: Click Add Friend . This is the green button at the top, next to Blocked .

steps.title: Enter the person's username.
steps.content: Enter the person's username. Use the field underneath ADD FRIEND to enter the username. Unlike Discord Tags, which were case-sensitive, Discord usernames can be any case. [3] X Research source If the person you're adding hasn't converted their Discord Tag (the ones ending in numbers like #1000), enter their tag with the proper capitalization.

steps.title: Click Send Friend Request.
steps.content: Click Send Friend Request . This is the purple-blue icon to the right of the Discord Tag field. You'll see the prompt: "Success! Your friend request to [user] was sent." When the user accepts, you can find them in your friend list by clicking All . Otherwise, you'll see your request in the Pending tab. You can also add a friend by clicking the Send Friend Request button on their profile. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Discord app.
steps.content: Open the Discord app. Discord is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . To find your own Discord Tag, swipe right to access the menu, then tap your profile picture in the bottom-right corner. Your tag will be at the top of the page.

steps.title: Swipe right to access the menu.
steps.content: Swipe right to access the menu. You'll see a row of icons at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the "Friends" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "Friends" icon. This looks like a person waving. A new page will open.

steps.title: Tap the "Add Friend" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "Add Friend" icon. This looks like a person with a "+" at the top-right corner.

steps.title: Enter the person's username.
steps.content: Enter the person's username. Tap the field under "ADD VIA USERNAME", then enter your friend's username. Unlike Discord Tags, which were case-sensitive, Discord's new usernames are not case-sensitive. If the person you're adding hasn't converted their older Discord Tag that ended with a number (e.g., test#0000), enter the tag with the proper capitalization. You can also tap Find your friends to search via synced contacts or Nearby scan to search for friends using Bluetooth and Wi-Fi.

steps.title: Tap Send Friend Request.
steps.content: Tap Send Friend Request . This is the purple-blue button below the username field. When the user accepts, you can find them in your friend list by clicking All . Otherwise, you'll see your request in the Pending tab.

steps.title: Add users from mutual servers (optional).
steps.content: Add users from mutual servers (optional). To add a friend from a server: Join a server and swipe left to the Members page. You may need to do this twice. Tap the user you want to add and select Add Friend . This is the green person icon. When the person accepts, they'll appear in your friend list in the All tab. [5] X Research source
